### Question 12

If you get the error

```{r echo=FALSE, error=TRUE}
data <- data.frame(
  id=c(1, 1, 2, 2),
  time=c(1, 2, 1, 2),
  x1=c(5, 3, 6, 2),
  x2=c(5, 6, 1, 4)
)
gather(data, id=c("id","time"))
```

which package have you forgotten to load?

A.  `dplyr`

    ```{r}
    library(dplyr)
    exists('gather', where='package:dplyr', mode='function')
    ```
B.  `tibble`

    ```{r}
    library(tibble)
    exists('gather', where='package:tibble', mode='function')
    ```
C.  `resize2`

    ```{r, error=TRUE}
    library(resize2)
    exists('gather', where='package:resize2', mode='function')
    ```
D.  `reshape2`

    ```{r}
    library(reshape2)
    exists('gather', where='package:reshape2', mode='function')
    ```
E.  `tidyr`

    ```{r}
    library(tidyr)
    exists('gather', where='package:tidyr', mode='function')
    ```

### Question 13

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
```

Given

```{r, echo=TRUE}
data <- data.frame(
  numbers=sample(1:10, 100, replace=TRUE)
)
c <- ggplot(data, aes(numbers))
```

Which one of the following commands will fail?

A.  `c + geom_area(stat = "bin")`

    ```{r}
    ggplot(data, aes(numbers)) + geom_area(stat = "bin")
    ```
B.  `c + geom_density(kernel = "gaussian")`

    ```{r}
    ggplot(data, aes(numbers)) + geom_density(kernel = "gaussian")
    ```
C.  `c + geom_point()`

    ```{r, error=TRUE}
    ggplot(data, aes(numbers)) + geom_point()
    ```
D.  `c + geom_dotplot()`

    ```{r}
    ggplot(data, aes(numbers)) + geom_dotplot()
    ```
E.  `c + geom_histogram()`

    ```{r}
    ggplot(data, aes(numbers)) + geom_histogram()
    ```

## Some coding questions

### Question 17

Given

```{r}
v <- c(104, 97, 108, 108, 111, 119, 101, 101, 110)
```

Match the following codes with their result.

<div class="row">
<div class="column left">
Codes

1. `intToUtf8(v)`
2. `v %% 2`
3. `v %/% 2`
4. `as.roman(v)`
4. `as.hexmode(v)`
4. `as.logical(v)`
</div>
<div class="column right">
Result

A.  `r intToUtf8(v)`
B.  `r v %% 2`
C.  `r v %/% 2`
D.  `r as.roman(v)`
E.  `r as.hexmode(v)`
F.  `r as.logical(v)`
</div>
</div>

### Question 16

Given

```{r}
library(nycflights13)
flights %>%
  head(5) %>%
  knitr::kable()
```

Replace `▮▮▮▮▮▮▮▮ ` with the name of one function in

```
flights %>%
  ▮▮▮▮▮▮▮▮(year, month, day) %>%
  ▮▮▮▮▮▮▮▮(arr_delay, dep_delay) %>%
  ▮▮▮▮▮▮▮▮(
    arr = mean(arr_delay, na.rm = TRUE),
    dep = mean(dep_delay, na.rm = TRUE)
  ) %>%
  ▮▮▮▮▮▮▮▮(arr > 30 | dep > 30) 
```

for have the output as show below.

```{r}
flights %>%
  group_by(year, month, day) %>%
  select(arr_delay, dep_delay) %>%
  summarise(
    arr = mean(arr_delay, na.rm = TRUE),
    dep = mean(dep_delay, na.rm = TRUE)
  ) %>%
  filter(arr > 30 | dep > 30) %>%
  head(5) %>%
  knitr::kable()
```
